title: 114_s1479
content: The Act may be cited as the "Brownfields Utilization, Investment, and Local Development Act of 2015" or the "BUILD Act." Expanded eligibility for nonprofit organizations is also included. The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include expanded eligibility for nonprofit organizations, limited liability corporations, and limited partnerships with specific criteria. The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include expanded eligibility for nonprofit organizations, limited liability corporations, and limited partnerships meeting specific criteria, including those with general partners that are described organizations or limited liability corporations with sole members being described organizations, or qualified community development entities. SEC. 3. MULTIPURPOSE BROWNFIELDS GRANTS. Section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to establish a program for multipurpose brownfields grants to eligible entities for various activities related to inventory, characterization, assessment, planning, or remediation. The program for multipurpose brownfields grants under Section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 allows eligible entities to conduct activities such as inventory, characterization, assessment, planning, or remediation at brownfield sites. Each grant awarded shall not exceed $950,000, and the total grants for each fiscal year shall not exceed 15 percent of the funds available. The Administrator considers the ability of the entity to provide an overall plan when awarding grants. The program for multipurpose brownfields grants allows eligible entities to conduct activities at brownfield sites. Each grant awarded shall not exceed $950,000, and the total grants for each fiscal year shall not exceed 15 percent of the funds available. Eligible entities must demonstrate the capacity to conduct eligible activities and show that the grant will meet the needs of the brownfield sites. As a condition of receiving a grant, each entity must expend the full amount within 3 years. The grant awarded to eligible entities must be expended within 3 years unless an extension is granted by the Administrator. Section 104(k)(2) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to allow governmental entities to receive grants for brownfield sites acquired before January 11, 2002, even if they do not qualify as bona fide prospective purchasers, as long as they have not caused or contributed to hazardous substance releases. Increased funding for remediation grants under the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is now set at $500,000 per site, with a possible waiver up to $650,000 based on contamination levels, size, or ownership status. Additionally, grant recipients are now allowed to use funds for administrative costs. Paragraph (5) of section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include changes in subparagraphs and clauses, with a new addition regarding administrative costs. An eligible entity can use up to 8 percent of grant or loan amounts for administrative costs, excluding investigation, response action design, and natural resource monitoring. SEC. 7. SMALL COMMUNITY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS. In section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980, definitions for "disadvantaged area" and "small community" are provided based on income levels. The Administrator will establish a program to provide grants for small communities with a population of not more than 15,000 individuals, using up to $600,000 for disadvantaged community recipients. The Administrator will establish a program to provide grants of up to $7,500 to States for small communities, Indian tribes, rural areas, or disadvantaged areas to achieve specific purposes. SEC. 8. WATERFRONT BROWNFIELDS GRANTS. Section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include provisions for waterfront brownfield sites, defining them as brownfield sites adjacent to water or a federally designated floodplain. The Administrator is required to consider these sites when providing grants and give them special consideration. SEC. 9. CLEAN ENERGY BROWNFIELDS GRANTS. Section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to include clean energy projects at brownfield sites, defined as facilities generating renewable electricity or energy efficiency improvements. The Administrator will establish a grant program for eligible entities to implement these projects. The Administrator will establish a grant program for eligible entities to carry out activities for clean energy projects at brownfield sites, with a maximum grant amount of $500,000. SEC. 10 amends section 104(k) of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act to allow the Administrator to provide targeted funding of up to $2,000,000 to States for authorized purposes. States must have used at least 50% of the previous year's funding for assessment and remediation activities. SEC. 11 authorizes appropriations. SEC. 11 authorizes appropriations for Brownfields Revitalization Funding and State Response Programs under the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980, amending the years from 2006 to 2018.
